== Ubuntu Server Guide - Raring ==

The <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/serverguide | Ubuntu Server Guide project]]</nowiki> is part of System Documentation and, as such, everything that has been written on that topic applies equally here.  Follow the above links to understand the process of contributing to Ubuntu System Documentation.

The purpose of this page is to organize contributions made to the Server Guide for the upcoming Ubuntu release.  It is also cool to see what other people are up to.  Subscribe to this page!

In addition to this focus wiki page, there is a focus Launchpad team replete with a mailing list.  If you are committed to the improvement of the Guide please do become a member of the <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/~serverguide-helpers | Ubuntu Server Guide Helpers]]</nowiki> team!

Here are ways to contribute, in order of priority:

# '''Review''' on a <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/DocumentationTeam/TechReview | technical]]</nowiki> and <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/DocumentationTeam/StyleGuide | style]]</nowiki> level.
# '''Correct''' (and/or Triage) a filed bug.  <nowiki>[[https://bugs.launchpad.net/serverguide | Ubuntu Server Guide Bugs]]</nowiki>
# '''Extend''' by adding a significant amount of new information (possibly new sub-chapter or an entirely new chapter).  Let <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/%7Epetermatulis/+contactuser | me]]</nowiki> know of your intentions.
# '''Propose''' ideas for improvement (new topics, re-organization).  There is a Discussion section at the bottom.

Useful links:

* Current release guide: <nowiki>[[https://help.ubuntu.com/12.10/serverguide/C/index.html | Ubuntu Server Guide - Quantal]]</nowiki>
* Last release version of this document: <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/DocumentationTeam/SystemDocumentation/QuantalUbuntuServerGuide | QuantalUbuntuServerGuide]]</nowiki>

=== Kickstart ===

Here are some sample core commands for someone (local user ''john'' with a Launchpad id of ''johnlpid'') wishing to review sub-chapter 6.1 (OpenLDAP section under Network Authentication chapter) for Ubuntu 13.04.  Please do read up on what they do; it's all explained in the links at the top of the page.

''Change text in the below commands to fit your own situation (ex: do not paste in 6.1 if you're not reviewing 6.1).''

'''1. Get the repository'''

<pre>
sudo apt-get install bzr docbook docbook-xsl xsltproc libxml2-utils yelp-tools
mkdir ~/sguide-1304
cd ~/sguide-1304
bzr branch lp:serverguide serverguide-review-6.1
</pre>

'''2. Review and edit the material (a little bit at a time)'''

<pre>
cd serverguide-review-6.1
vi serverguide/C/network-auth.xml
make serverguide-html
</pre>

'''3. View and verify the changes in your browser'''

<pre>
firefox build/serverguide/C/openldap-server.html
</pre>

Repeat the above 2 steps until crispy.

'''4. Send the modified repository to your Launchpad account'''

<pre> 
scripts/validate.sh serverguide/C/serverguide.xml
bzr commit -m 'Reviewing sub-chapter 6.1; other notes can go here'
bzr push lp:~johnlpid/serverguide/serverguide-review-6.1
</pre>

'''5. Submit a proposal to merge the modifications with the main branch'''

Enter the Code section of your Launchpad account, select the appropriate branch, and submit a merge proposal.

=== Alternative help method ===

Although the above is the preferred method for contributing, if you find it too laborious or you just can't make it work an alternative route is to <nowiki>[[https://bugs.launchpad.net/serverguide/+filebug | create a bug]]</nowiki> about what you think is wrong in the guide and include some replacement text.  Of course, if you are working already from an existing bug then just add the text in a new bug comment.  If you have multiple bugs that affect the same sub-chapter then create a single bug for all of them.

Here are the best ways to get answers to any questions you may have:

* The <nowiki>[[https://lists.ubuntu.com/mailman/listinfo/ubuntu-doc | Ubuntu Doc mailing list]]</nowiki>
* The <nowiki>[[https://lists.ubuntu.com/mailman/listinfo/ubuntu-server | Ubuntu Server mailing list]]</nowiki>
* The Driver of this project, <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/%7Epetermatulis/+contactuser | Peter Matulis]]</nowiki>.

=== Deadline ===

All final merge proposals should be made by April 4, 2013.  See <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/DocumentationStringFreeze | DocumentationStringFreeze]]</nowiki> and <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/RaringRingtail/ReleaseSchedule | RaringRingtailReleaseSchedule]]</nowiki>.
